verses.niv: 28 A perverse man stirs up dissension, and a gossip separates close friends.
verses.kjv: 28 A froward man soweth strife: and a whisperer separateth chief friends.
verses.esv:
28   A dishonest man spreads strife,
    and a whisperer separates close friends.

verses.niv: 19 A gossip betrays a confidence; so avoid a man who talks too much.
verses.kjv: 19 He that goeth about as a talebearer revealeth secrets: therefore meddle not with him that flattereth with his lips.
verses.esv:
19   Whoever goes about slandering reveals secrets;
    therefore do not associate with a simple babbler.

verses.niv: 29 Do not let any unwholesome talk come out of your mouths, but only what is helpful for building others up according to their needs, that it may benefit those who listen.
verses.kjv: 29 Let no corrupt communication proceed out of your mouth, but that which is good to the use of edifying, that it may minister grace unto the hearers.
verses.esv: 29 Let no corrupting talk come out of your mouths, but only such as is good for building up, as fits the occasion, that it may give grace to those who hear.

verses.niv: 13 A gossip betrays a confidence, but a trustworthy man keeps a secret.
verses.kjv: 13 A talebearer revealeth secrets: but he that is of a faithful spirit concealeth the matter.
verses.esv:
13   Whoever goes about slandering reveals secrets,
    but he who is trustworthy in spirit keeps a thing covered.

verses.niv: 20 Without wood a fire goes out; without gossip a quarrel dies down.
verses.kjv: 20 Where no wood is, there the fire goeth out: so where there is no talebearer, the strife ceaseth.
verses.esv:
20   For lack of wood the fire goes out,
    and where there is no whisperer, quarreling ceases.

verses.niv: 16 "'Do not go about spreading slander among your people. "'Do not do anything that endangers your neighbor's life. I am the LORD.
verses.kjv: 16 Thou shalt not go up and down as a talebearer among thy people: neither shalt thou stand against the blood of thy neighbour: I am the LORD.
verses.esv: 16 You shall not go around as a slanderer among your people, and you shall not stand up against the life of your neighbor: I am the LORD.

verses.niv: 8 The words of a gossip are like choice morsels; they go down to a man's inmost parts.
verses.kjv: 8 The words of a talebearer are as wounds, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.
verses.esv:
8   The words of a whisperer are like delicious morsels;
    they go down into the inner parts of the body.

verses.niv: 13 Besides, they get into the habit of being idle and going about from house to house. And not only do they become idlers, but also gossips and busybodies, saying things they ought not to.
verses.kjv: 13 And withal they learn to be idle, wandering about from house to house; and not only idle, but tattlers also and busybodies, speaking things which they ought not.
verses.esv: 13 Besides that, they learn to be idlers, going about from house to house, and not only idlers, but also gossips and busybodies, saying what they should not.

verses.niv: 20 For I am afraid that when I come I may not find you as I want you to be, and you may not find me as you want me to be. I fear that there may be quarreling, jealousy, outbursts of anger, factions, slander, gossip, arrogance and disorder.
verses.kjv: 20 For I fear, lest, when I come, I shall not find you such as I would, and that I shall be found unto you such as ye would not: lest there be debates, envyings, wraths, strifes, backbitings, whisperings, swellings, tumults:
verses.esv: 20 For I fear that perhaps when I come I may find you not as I wish, and that you may find me not as you wish—that perhaps there may be quarreling, jealousy, anger, hostility, slander, gossip, conceit, and disorder.

verses.niv: 13 keep your tongue from evil and your lips from speaking lies.
verses.kjv: 13 Keep thy tongue from evil, and thy lips from speaking guile.
verses.esv:
13   Keep your tongue from evil
    and your lips from speaking deceit.

verses.niv: 26 If anyone considers himself religious and yet does not keep a tight rein on his tongue, he deceives himself and his religion is worthless.
verses.kjv: 26 If any man among you seem to be religious, and bridleth not his tongue, but deceiveth his own heart, this man’s religion is vain.
verses.esv: 26 If anyone thinks he is religious and does not bridle his tongue but deceives his heart, this person’s religion is worthless.

verses.niv: 1 "Do not spread false reports. Do not help a wicked man by being a malicious witness.
verses.kjv: 1 Thou shalt not raise a false report: put not thine hand with the wicked to be an unrighteous witness.
verses.esv: 23:1 “You shall not spread a false report. You shall not join hands with a wicked man to be a malicious witness.

verses.niv: 18 He who conceals his hatred has lying lips, and whoever spreads slander is a fool.
verses.kjv: 18 He that hideth hatred with lying lips, and he that uttereth a slander, is a fool.
verses.esv:
18   The one who conceals hatred has lying lips,
    and whoever utters slander is a fool.

verses.niv: 11 Brothers, do not slander one another. Anyone who speaks against his brother or judges him speaks against the law and judges it. When you judge the law, you are not keeping it, but sitting in judgment on it.
verses.kjv: 11 Speak not evil one of another, brethren. He that speaketh evil of his brother, and judgeth his brother, speaketh evil of the law, and judgeth the law: but if thou judge the law, thou art not a doer of the law, but a judge.
verses.esv: 11 Do not speak evil against one another, brothers. The one who speaks against a brother or judges his brother, speaks evil against the law and judges the law. But if you judge the law, you are not a doer of the law but a judge.

verses.niv: 29 They have become filled with every kind of wickedness, evil, greed and depravity. They are full of envy, murder, strife, deceit and malice. They are gossips,
verses.kjv: 29 Being filled with all unrighteousness, fornication, wickedness, covetousness, maliciousness; full of envy, murder, debate, deceit, malignity; whisperers,
verses.esv: 29 They were filled with all manner of unrighteousness, evil, covetousness, malice. They are full of envy, murder, strife, deceit, maliciousness. They are gossips,

verses.niv: 5 Whoever slanders his neighbor in secret, him will I put to silence; whoever has haughty eyes and a proud heart, him will I not endure.
verses.kjv: 5 Whoso privily slandereth his neighbour, him will I cut off: him that hath an high look and a proud heart will not I suffer.
verses.esv:
5   Whoever slanders his neighbor secretly
    I will destroy.
  Whoever has a haughty look and an arrogant heart
    I will not endure.

verses.niv: 16 There are six things the LORD hates, seven that are detestable to him: 17 haughty eyes, a lying tongue, hands that shed innocent blood, 18 a heart that devises wicked schemes, feet that are quick to rush into evil, 19 a false witness who pours out lies and a man who stirs up dissension among brothers.
verses.kjv: 16 These six things doth the LORD hate: yea, seven are an abomination unto him: 17 A proud look, a lying tongue, and hands that shed innocent blood, 18 An heart that deviseth wicked imaginations, feet that be swift in running to mischief, 19 A false witness that speaketh lies, and he that soweth discord among brethren.
verses.esv:
16   There are six things that the LORD hates,
    seven that are an abomination to him:
17   haughty eyes, a lying tongue,
    and hands that shed innocent blood,
18   a heart that devises wicked plans,
    feet that make haste to run to evil,
19   a false witness who breathes out lies,
    and one who sows discord among brothers.

verses.niv: 23 He who guards his mouth and his tongue keeps himself from calamity.
verses.kjv: 23 Whoso keepeth his mouth and his tongue keepeth his soul from troubles.
verses.esv:
23   Whoever keeps his mouth and his tongue
    keeps himself out of trouble.

verses.niv: 22 The words of a gossip are like choice morsels; they go down to a man's inmost parts.
verses.kjv: 22 The words of a talebearer are as wounds, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.
verses.esv:
22   The words of a whisperer are like delicious morsels;
    they go down into the inner parts of the body.

verses.niv: 4 A wicked man listens to evil lips; a liar pays attention to a malicious tongue.
verses.kjv: 4 A wicked doer giveth heed to false lips; and a liar giveth ear to a naughty tongue.
verses.esv:
4   An evildoer listens to wicked lips,
    and a liar gives ear to a mischievous tongue.

verses.niv: 9 With his mouth the godless destroys his neighbor, but through knowledge the righteous escape.
verses.kjv: 9 An hypocrite with his mouth destroyeth his neighbour: but through knowledge shall the just be delivered.
verses.esv:
9   With his mouth the godless man would destroy his neighbor,
    but by knowledge the righteous are delivered.

verses.niv: 2 to slander no one, to be peaceable and considerate, and to show true humility toward all men.
verses.kjv: 2 To speak evil of no man, to be no brawlers, but gentle, shewing all meekness unto all men.
verses.esv: 2 to speak evil of no one, to avoid quarreling, to be gentle, and to show perfect courtesy toward all people.

verses.niv: 9 He who covers over an offense promotes love, but whoever repeats the matter separates close friends.
verses.kjv: 9 He that covereth a transgression seeketh love; but he that repeateth a matter separateth very friends.
verses.esv:
9   Whoever covers an offense seeks love,
    but he who repeats a matter separates close friends.

verses.niv: 3 Set a guard over my mouth, O LORD; keep watch over the door of my lips.
verses.kjv: 3 Set a watch, O LORD, before my mouth; keep the door of my lips.
verses.esv:
3   Set a guard, O LORD, over my mouth;
    keep watch over the door of my lips!

verses.niv: 23 As a north wind brings rain, so a sly tongue brings angry looks.
verses.kjv: 23 The north wind driveth away rain: so doth an angry countenance a backbiting tongue.
verses.esv:
23   The north wind brings forth rain,
    and a backbiting tongue, angry looks.
